Groovy music made the dinner casual.
I have a but here - there was a bathroom attendant in the restroom which was odd.

column2: small positive <sep> two positive <sep> toilets positive <sep> staying negative <sep> towels positive <sep> dispenser. positive
column4: The bathroom itself is very small with two toilets and only one sink, the girl was staying totally on the way hanging out paper towels from the dispenser.
This place rocks!!
The atmosphere is aspiring, and the decor is festive and amazing..

column3: Raouls chicken vegetable soup positive <sep> catering positive
column4: The catering is out of this world, and Raouls chicken vegetable soup rocks my world!!!
- Mediocre Service/Quality

column3: Snooze positive <sep> menu negative <sep> Snooze negative
column4: The presentation of Snooze is excellent and it is one of those places that you feel more sophisticated just for being there; but peel back the layers and you have an overpriced IHOP with a high brow menu.
To start off, approximately 8-10 oz of orange juice will cost you $3.
They serve it in a tall, skinny hour-glass shaped glass to disguise the fact that you a getting a small juice at the price of a half gallon in a supermarket.
I should have just asked for the check when I saw that; but their menu was so unique that I continued.
The pancakes were certainly inventive but $8.50 for 3 - 6" pancakes (one of them was more like 5") in the pancake flight (sample of 3 different pancakes) is well over-priced.
The pancakes should be larger (at least 8") to justify the expense even with the unique offerings.
On my meal I had to send back my eggs for a simple request of breaking the yokes before cooking, and would have had to send them back again if I hadn't rejected the meal all together.
I rejected it because in the process of attempting to fix the eggs they broke something else in the dish and I was too frustrated to continue.

column2: burrito, positive <sep> iced positive <sep> water). negative
column3: pancakes negative <sep> breakfast burrito negative <sep> orange juice negative <sep> iced tea negative
column4: In the end our check came to $27 for 4 small pancakes, a breakfast burrito, an orange juice and an iced tea (I had water).
– I am exceedingly pleased to report that my dinner at Ray's Boathouse last Friday completely exceeded my expectations.

column2: Ray's positive <sep> accolades negative <sep> food positive
column4: Ray's is something of a Seattle institution, but given its gorgeous Sound views, I had suspected that the accolades were more due to the scenery than to the food and service.
Imagine my happy surprise upon finding that the views are only the third-best thing about Ray's!

column2: start positive <sep> lovely positive <sep> server negative
column4: To start things off, our lovely server Brooke was quickly on hand to take my drink order.

column2: prawns, negative <sep> manila positive <sep> dill, positive <sep> dressing, negative
column3: white gulf prawns positive <sep> manila clams positive <sep> soy dressing positive <sep> butter sauce positive <sep> Shilshole Sampler positive
column4: My party of two was feeling particularly ambitious, and we splurged on the Shilshole Sampler...a beautiful assortment of enormous white gulf prawns, smoked albacore tuna, Ray's fantastic manila clams seasoned with dill, scallops in a tasty soy dressing, and a tiny pile of Dungeness crab atop a sublime butter sauce.
For my entrée, I completely enjoyed the seared Alaskan sea scallops complemented by chard, artichoke hearts, fennel, and pecorino toscano.
The scallops are apparently cooked in a black olive butter which really makes them unique (not to mention tasty).

column3: grilled Alaskan King Salmon positive <sep> creamed Washington russet potatoes positive <sep> green beans positive
column4: My friend enjoyed the grilled Alaskan King Salmon with delectable creamed Washington russet potatoes and crisp green beans.
I had a taste of all three items on her plate, and they were superb.

column2: throughout neutral <sep> I negative <sep> issue: positive <sep> place negative <sep> take negative
column4: Our server continued to be attentive throughout the night, but I did remain puzzled by one issue: Who thinks that Ray's is an appropriate place to take young children for dinner?
All considered, I have to say that Ray's Boathouse is deserving of its title as a Seattle institution.
Oh yeah...the view was good, too.
